column5: I remember Mahovolich,Howe and Delviccio when they played for Detroit when I was a youngster.The production line. Joe
Classic fight but it always burned me that Hex was quick to drop his gloves but not his helmet.  99, 66, 19, 4
That would be the 2.0 version.

X2 for me  No one current to today has played the game like #4 Bobby Orr. Retired at 28 cause his knees where screwed. Never played an NHL game with good legs...cause he already had knee troubles in Junior. I can't even begin to imagine Orr coming to the NHL in good health and having a 20 year career like a lot of other defencemen.  No one else measures up.
the one and only #99
#7 no question...much more enjoyable than watching the overpaid...
I have his skates from his 95/96 season in TO.  Me, I wear 13 because I like it, don't care who else wore or wears it.
Johnny Bower was 1 as well.   Before my time but he was awesome none the less.
Have A sign picture of Johnny on the wall
For the Defensemen....#2  Brain Leetch Al MacInnis Dave Ellet Brian Marchment Rick Natress Luke Richardson Ulf Samuelson Luke Schenn Todd Simpson Scott Stevens Yours truely...  To name a few
Number fourrra Bobby Orrrrra.
Was a big flyer's fan in the 70's #16  http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5168/5274077409_9bdb3a4f58_o.jpg
Number 27 - Ron Hextall.  Always enjoyed watching him play
You forgot this guy,,,,,,

Hey J this was a clasic,,  <object style="height: 390px; width: 640px"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CnJqCZDcex0?version=3"><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CnJqCZDcex0?version=3"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CnJqCZDcex0?version=3" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always" width="640" height="390"></object>

Hey you guys forgot #22 John Ferguson.... toughest guy on ice  John Ferguson
Yup, that was great B
So you think you're a tough guy.#8
in sports i've always been #5...  i did so because i was a jesse barfield fan back in the 80's and it stuck from t-ball, through my formative years in baseball, and into hockey as i got into that.
ill take #17 in blue n white any day!! or 87, the new and improved 99......
First name that comes to mind for 27 is the " Big M " Frank Mahovlich, 52 goals in a 50 game season, Leafs could use a scorer like that today.

My aunt has a game used Bower goalie stick signed by the cup winning team.  He personally got it signed for my grandparents after a game at the gardens.  He threw it over the boards to my grandparents because it got a little crack in it on a shot.  They took it to the dressing room after the game.  Back when you could do that.  He popped his head out of the dressing room and my grandparents asked him to sign it.  He said give me a few minutes and came back after getting the whole team to sign it.  It was the 1964 team I think.  Carl Brewers name is on it.  Carl was not on the 1967 team.  I think Bathgate is on it.  He was on the 64 team but not the 63 or 62.  Anyways cool story.
Carl Brewer
17 for wendel clark and 27 for sittler.  4 for mr bobby orr the greatest to ever play the game!
No doubt the leafs could use the big M, but he never scored 50 goals in a season, let alone in 50 games.
Correct.  He must be mixing the stats up with his final St Mikes year at 52 goals in 49 games.  The big M did score 48 for the Leafs and 49 for the Red Wings.

Separating the wheat from the chaff  Eddie shore Doug Harvy Bobby Orr in Oshawa  I've got a book somewhere from a few years ago that listed the "best" players to wear each number in the NHL. Some numbers had some stiff competition 1 through 10 in particular. Some numbers had only 1 or 2 players to have ever worn them at the point of publishing.
I remember when Vaive scored 50 for the leafs it had been Frank's record.
The book is called "By the numbers".  I have it kicking around on one of my shelves somewhere.

# 11, #13, #19 all for the Nordiques. Owen Nolan, Mats Sundin, and Joe Sakic. Would have won the cup if not for the labor stopage. Couldn't bring my self to follow the Avalanche so I stopped cheering for any team and that led to a serious illness call Leafitis. We get hammered by the media through TSN and Sportsnet, you feel so bad for them you start to actually route for them. The perennial underdog.  I'll now go cry myself to sleep......again....
#22, Ken Baumgartner  Got an autographed jersey hanging up in my office.
I have got to give it up for the number 9.The Rocket,Gordie and Bobby Hull.Next favorite(favourite) the number 25.Franceschetti,and Chimera on the Caps. Joe
No question 19  Sakic Steve Y thornton  and aon and on
4,  nuff said. 27 was another good #
Bobby Orr?The man!
#12 - Yvan Cournyer - yup - I am THAT old
Bobby Orr, Red Kelly, Jean Beliveau
oh boy
Brain fart was meaning Bobby Orr.Good choice.
Well Joe 99 or 66 and 77 comes to mind Gretsky, Lemieux and Bourque
#19 Yzerman
For me it's #19 but for Paul Henderson - 1972
Ha yes number 4 Mike Pelyk
17 Wendal Clark!!!!  The way hockey should be played!

#4----ORR, no-brainer...#27 Sittler, class act, still holds the most points in a game record, AND, still the greatest Leafs captain of all time.  Also, no player has stood up to Leafs ownership/management they way he did when he tore the C off his jersey, and, did an interview for Hockey Night In Canada, when Lanny McDonald was traded.

#6 - our eldest son's. I had more fun watching him play than all the pro's I ever watched. He wore that number thru all the years and all the myriad sports he played save for baseball when for a reason I can't remember he was #15 so I guess that would be my second choice. If any of the great pro's happened to share his choices they were probably copying him.  8)  JF
16, 9 and 7. All were worn by Bobby Hull durning his career. His brother wore 9 I believe.
in my mind there is only 1...#4
has to be 27, forget Sittler and all the others, it was also worn by the late great John Kordic

I like 19 for a centre ice man.  Sakic, Yzerman.  I like number 4 for a defenceman.  Bobby Orr.  I like 29 for a goalie.  Potvin was a tank in the early nineties, a great time to be a teenage hockey fan in Leaf land.  For a winger I like single digit "power forward" numbers.  9 Howe, 8 Neely, 7 Roberts (toronto).  Nothing wrong with 10 (Roberts) and 17 either.
number 14. For the leafs is the all time great centre. If you need to be told whom it is . You don't know hockey.
Memory is not as good as it used to be - but would that be Dave Keon by chance?  Tracker (Don)
Here's 3 more. 1,Jacque Plant 29, Ken Dryden. 33,Patrick Roy.
29 How can I forget.... Ken Dryden!!!  Greatest goalie of it's time
You got it Don. Davey Keon. I remember when I was a litter gaffer. All I want for Xmas was a number 14 leaf jersey.
LOL - was never a leaf fan ( always a Habs fan) - but Keon was a very tallented hockey player that I feel never got the credit that he deserved.   Tracker (Don)
